Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different habitats on land and in water, such as a playground, garden, forest, pond, or stream.
The student can illustrate a variety of living things found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can compare the types of living things by showing how plants and animals in one habitat are similar to or different from those in another habitat.
The student can observe and draw patterns, showing the diversity of plants and animals in the natural world across different habitats.
